primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God acts as a revolutionary force in history to liberate the oppressed, which evokes a 'new song' from His people that defies the silencing powers of the status quo.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord makes poor and makes rich
He has brought down the powerful from their thrones
The LORD goes forth like a soldier

object.identificatie: Restorative freedom and the healing of the world
tekstueel_bewijs: the world will, by the power of God, be healed and made right
emancipation from the coercive requirements of Pharaoh

zender.identificatie: The 'Old, Old Story' (The Narrative of Covenant/Easter)
tekstueel_bewijs: they knew the old, old story behind the song
the narrative that defies all of our critical work

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Company of Singers' (The Church/The Poor/The Oppressed)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has set down a company of singers
filled the hungry with good things
what a dangerous song is put on our lips by the spirit
ordination today is primarily so that the church does not lose itself

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Dominant Society' / National Security State / Numbness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just personal bad habits but systemic 'powers' (Pharaoh, Rome, Consumerism) that seek to cause ontological amnesia and death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ordained teacher (Robert) must faithfully teach the 'old story' so that the church can maintain its 'new song'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Teacher (Robert)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The preservation of the church's memory/song
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action of teaching is a secondary program that serves the primary program of God's ongoing liberation.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Old Story → Restorative Freedom → The Lowly/Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Spirit/Teachers → God ← The National Security State

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has set down a company of singers
The Lord goes forth like a soldier

voorbeelden: You will be expected to hone your critical skills
this is how our dominant society wants it to be
they knew the old, old story
unless there are teachers... there will be no singing
by the power of God, be healed

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God that enables the 'Knowing' (Savoir) of the church, which results in the 'Song'. It avoids the 'Must' (Devoir) of moralism.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Silence' of the rat-race (S2) through the 'Numbness' of narcotics (~S1) to the recovery of the 'Old Story' (~S2) which erupts into the 'New Song' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Forceful Agent' (God) who breaks the silence, making the 'Old Story' become the 'New Song'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the powers of death and the 'National Security State' are presented as formidable and active.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor in the verbs of salvation and liberation. Human response (singing) is a derivative 'unleashed power' rather than a condition for God's action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You will be expected to hone your critical skills

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has brought down the powerful... and lifted the lowly

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Grace as the endowment of competence
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: what a dangerous song is put on our lips by the spirit

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Miriam, Hannah, and Mary are not used as moral examples of 'how to be brave,' but as witnesses to what God has done.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: These figures sing because God acted; the focus remains on God's triumph over Pharaoh/Rome.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Liberation from the 'rat-race' and anxiety; empowerment through memory.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology precedes ethics; the song is the fruit of the rescue.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: God's primary program of liberation funds the secondary program of the church's witness.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God has defeated the claims of Pharaoh... God of Easter is stronger than the deathly power

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit puts the song on the lips, granting the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability to sing) to the formerly mute.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as a 'National Security State' and a 'culture of anxiety' that silences the human soul.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the cosmic drama, with the church as the joyful Receiver/Witness.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Pouvoir (Power) and Savoir (Knowing).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it avoids the 'legalism' of Devoir.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent is already highly intensified (Pharaoh, Rome, Empire).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses narrative semiotics to dismantle the 'numbness' of the modern subject by re-centering the agency of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on Brueggemann's poetic use of 'Old/New', Greimas reveals that the 'Old Story' functions as the Sender (Destinateur) that mandates the 'New Song'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the individual contexts of Miriam or Mary; Greimas shows they all occupy the same functional actant role across time.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'earthquake' in Acts 16 is a semiotic manifestation of the 'Subject' (God) responding to the 'Helper' (the Song).

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 'Old Story' as a semiotic reservoir that prevents the 'Subject' (the Church) from falling into the 'Opponent's' trap of amnesia.
